title: Were Soviet tanks literally drove straight from the assembly lines to the battlefield during WW2? - Quora

response.answer_text: You see references to that in several novels and in histories that involve the battle of Leningrad. During the siege factories continued to operate and factory workers would go directly from the assembly lines to the battle lines. In short the answer is yes, but Leningrad is the only place where you can find it documented.

The answer is yes. When the Axis were threatening Moscow in 1941, unpainted tanks were sent straight to the front. The trolley system also ended abruptly at the front lines and was used to bring troops into battle.
